Detailed Description

This class provides 3d-vector type.

Basically this is a cartesian vector. In addition to the usual operation with vectors in Cartesian coordinates the following operation are provided:

  • componentwise product,
  • componentwise division,
  • reading/writing from/to binary file,
  • seting/coping components from/to array.
This class can be used for storing the coordinates of a point or vector in other coordinate system. The transformations between cartesian and cylindrical point or vector are provided; Operations with vectors in cylindrical(or other) coordinates are not defined.
Usage:
 #include "CVector3d.h"
 int main() {
   Vector3d a(1,2,3),b(4,2,3),c;
   a.x()= b.y();
   a[0] = b[1];  //the same as above
   double x=a*b; //dot product
   c=2/b; //componentwise division
   c=a/b; //componentwise division
   c=a^b; //cross product
   c=a&b; //componentwise product
   Vector3d *d = new Vector3d[100]; // array of vectors
 // do something with d, then save
   FILE *fp=fopen("test","wb");
   for(int i=0; i<100; i++) d[i].write(double(1),fp);
 }
Author:
Yuriy Turkin @ ipp mpg de
Examples:

1stexample.cpp, 2ndexample.cpp, 3dmeshtest.cpp, accuracytest.cpp, cpp2for.cpp, raytrace1.cpp, raytrace2.cpp, and remesh.cpp.

Definition at line 101 of file CVector3d.h.

size_t write ( T  x,
FILE *  fp 
) const

Write into binary file.

Parameters:
x is a dummy parameter used to choose float or double format for writing of vector components; x must be float(1) or double(1).
fp is the pointer to FILE structure
Returns:
3 - the number of components actually written, which may be less than 3 if an error occurs; see fwrite in <stdio.h>
Note:
fwrite from <stdio.h> is used because it fast; file must be opened before writing in binary mode: FILE *fp=fopen("test","wb");

Definition at line 123 of file CVector3d.h.

size_t read ( T  x,
FILE *  fp 
)

Read from binary file.

Parameters:
x is a dummy parameter used to specify the file format; x must be float(1) or double(1).
fp is the pointer to FILE structure
Returns:
3 - the number of components actually read, which may be less than 3 if an error occurs or if the end of the file is encountered; see fread in <stdio.h>
Note:
fread from <stdio.h> is used because it fast file must be opened before reading in binary mode: FILE *fp=fopen("test","rb");

void delComponent ( int  m  ) 

Delete component.

Method sets deleted component to zero and moves it to the end. Vector3d(1,2,3).delComponent(2) transforms to Vector3d(1,3,0)

Parameters:
m is the component to delete, m=0,1,2

double diffCyl2 ( const Vector3d &  c  ) 

The method returns dR^2, where dR is the distance between points c and this vector.

Both vectors are given in cylindrical coordinates.

The method returns dR.abs2(), where dR is the distance between points r and this vector.
